entry.title: SAP MDG: How to Grey Out Copy Button in ERP Vendor: Purchasing Organizations UIBB ?
entry.content:
Hi SCN Folks, 

Hope you guys are doing great üôÇ

Note 01: This blog does not include execution screenshots.
Note 02: The entire code was developed and validated in the SANDBOX system, with results meeting expectations.
Note 03: There are several ways; this blog is written about one of them.

Create customizing or enhance UIBB.

Standard Feeder Class: CL_BS_SP_GUIBB_PURCH_ORGS.

Create one custom class: ZCL_MDGS_GUIBB_PURCH_ORGS & do inherit above standard feeder class.

Now, utilize this method:  METHOD if_fpm_guibb_list~get_data.

Code:

CALL METHOD super->if_fpm_guibb_list~get_data
      EXPORTING
        iv_eventid                = iv_eventid
        it_selected_fields        = it_selected_fields
        iv_raised_by_own_ui       = iv_raised_by_own_ui
        iv_visible_rows           = iv_visible_rows
        iv_edit_mode              = iv_edit_mode
        io_extended_ctrl          = io_extended_ctrl
      IMPORTING
        et_messages               = et_messages
        ev_data_changed           = ev_data_changed
        ev_field_usage_changed    = ev_field_usage_changed
        ev_action_usage_changed   = ev_action_usage_changed
        ev_selected_lines_changed = ev_selected_lines_changed
        ev_dnd_attr_changed       = ev_dnd_attr_changed
        eo_itab_change_log        = eo_itab_change_log
      CHANGING
        ct_data                   = ct_data
        ct_field_usage            = ct_field_usage
        ct_action_usage           = ct_action_usage
        ct_selected_lines         = ct_selected_lines
        cv_lead_index             = cv_lead_index
        cv_first_visible_row      = cv_first_visible_row
        cs_additional_info        = cs_additional_info
        ct_dnd_attributes         = ct_dnd_attributes.

DATA :
      lv_cr_number TYPE usmd_crequest,
      lv_crtype    TYPE usmd_crequest_type,
      lv_process   TYPE usmd_process.

DATA(lo_context) = cl_usmd_app_context=>get_context( ).

IF lo_context IS BOUND.
   CALL METHOD lo_context->get_attributes
        IMPORTING
          ev_crequest_id   = lv_cr_number
          ev_crequest_type = lv_crtype
          ev_process       = lv_process.
ENDIF.

IF lv_crtype EQ 'ZMDGS01'.
  READ TABLE ct_action_usage ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<lfs_copy>) WITH KEY id = 'BOL_COPY'.
   <lfs_copy>-visible = '01'.
ENDIF.

 

SAP S/4HANA SAP Master Data Governance ABAP Development 

Thank You, 
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Community Profile | SAP Profile | LinkedIn

entry.title: From Foundation to Future: Master Data Management as the Fuel for Gen AI
entry.content:
In today's fast-paced business landscape, the role of Master Data Management (MDM) has evolved significantly, transitioning from a fundamental process improvement tool to a critical enabler of advanced analytics and AI. Join us for an interactive webinar, "From Foundation to Future: Master Data Management as the Fuel for Gen AI," where we delve into the evolution of MDM and its pivotal role in empowering next-generation AI technologies.

What to Expect

Introduction to The Hackett Group and Their Latest MDM Study

Kickstarting our session, we will introduce The Hackett Group and share insights from their latest 2025 MDM study. This will set the tone for our detailed discussion on the evolution and impact of Master Data Management.

Traditional Applications of MDM

We will then explore the traditional applications of MDM, highlighting its role in business process improvement. Through line-of-business-specific examples, you'll gain a clear understanding of how MDM has been utilized to streamline operations and enhance efficiency.

Contemporary MDM Use Cases

Diving deeper, we will examine more contemporary MDM use cases to illustrate how clean master data drives effective analytics, AI, and ultimately, improved decision-making. These examples will underscore the transformative potential of MDM in today's data-driven world.

SAP Master Data Governance

We will weave in throughout the capabilities of SAP Master Data Governance, demonstrating its role in achieving operational excellence and accurate analytics. Moreover, we will discuss how AI within MDM is driving new value and accelerating business process excellence.

Meet Our Speakers

Bryan DeGraw, Market Intelligence Analyst

Bryan DeGraw, Market Intelligence Analyst at The Hackett Group, is the author of their MDM Matrix Study. His insights and expertise in MDM will provide a comprehensive understanding of its past, present, and future.

Andreas Seifried, SAP MDM Product Management

Andreas Seifried, from SAP MDM Product Management, will share his knowledge on how SAP Master Data Governance can fuel enable businesses to stay ahead in the competitive marketplace.

Why Attend?

1. Insightful Perspectives: Gain valuable insights from industry experts on the evolution of MDM.
2. Practical Examples: Learn from real-world examples that demonstrate the impact of MDM on business processes and decision-making.
3. Future Trends: Understand how MDM is shaping the future of AI and how you can leverage it for your organization.
4. Interactive Session: Engage with our speakers through Q&A sessions and interactive discussions.

Register Now!

Don't miss out on this opportunity to explore how Master Data Management is impacting the business landscape. Register now to stay ahead of the curve and discover how MDM can be the fuel your organization needs to harness the power of Gen AI and secure operational excellence.

We look forward to seeing you at the webinar!

entry.title: SAP MDG: Auto-fill CR Description by Data Model and CR Type Description
entry.content:
Hi SCN Folks, 

Hope you guys are doing great üôÇ

Note 01: This blog does not include execution screenshots.
Note 02: The entire code was developed and validated in the SANDBOX system, with results meeting expectations.
Note 03: There are several ways; this blog is written about one of them.

BADI Responsible: USMD_CREQUEST_INTEGRATION.

Auto-populate the Change Request Description with the Data Model‚Äôs CR Type Description so every MDG CR is consistently and meaningfully described. 

Create Custom implementation & assign Data model filter values.

Method Responsible: if_ex_usmd_crequest_integr~get_crequest_attributes.

Code: 

METHOD if_ex_usmd_crequest_integr~get_crequest_attributes.

    SELECT SINGLE a~usmd_creq_type, a~usmd_model,  b~txtmi        
             FROM usmd110c AS a INNER JOIN
                  usmd110t AS b ON a~usmd_creq_type = b~usmd_creq_type
                               AND a~usmd_model EQ @iv_model
             INTO  @DATA(ls_cr_types)
            WHERE b~langu      EQ @SY-langu AND
                  a~usmd_creq_type = @iv_crequest_type.

    IF sy-subrc IS INITIAL.
      cv_description = ls_cr_types-txtmi.
    ENDIF.

  ENDMETHOD.

 

SAP S/4HANA SAP Master Data Governance ABAP Development 

Thank You, 
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Community Profile | SAP Profile | LinkedIn

entry.title: SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Product Release Highlights
entry.content:
Welcome to the SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Product Release Highlights! In this blog, we will journey through the latest advancements of this pivotal update.

This release brings together strategy, innovation, and intelligence ‚Äì uniting applications, data, and AI to help organizations transform how they operate and compete.

To get an overview of my personal highlights, you are welcome to watch my highlight video below.

 

 

Realizing our vision by bringing together apps, data, and AI

Whether it's refining finance with advanced AI agents, optimizing supply chain logistics, or advancing service management, each feature aims to enable agility and operational resilience. This release brings SAP's data strategy to life across applications, data integration and Business AI capabilities to empower businesses for the next leap. With AI at the top, SAP Business Data Cloud at the core, and deeply integrated applications as the foundation, organizations gain real-time insights, operational agility, and the ability to adapt and grow.

Our intelligent, modular, and configurable system is lifting ERP operations by placing people and roles at the forefront, surrounded by AI capabilities and intelligent agents. The integration with SAP Business Data Cloud enables organizations to unify and govern all SAP and third-party data, unlocking over 100 curated data products for richer insights and smarter decisions.

This update delivers innovations and enhancements across every line of business ‚Äì from Finance and Sourcing and Procurement to Manufacturing, Sales, and Service. 

In the sections that follow, we‚Äôll explore how these intelligent capabilities are enabling transformation across your ERP operations. 

 

Unleashing intelligence: SAP business AI and Joule AI agents at the forefront

Finance: Streamlining account receivables with Joule agent

In the area of Finance, SAP Cloud ERP Private introduces the beta version of the Joule agent for Accounts Receivables, contributing to financial management by streamlining overdue receivables analysis. Acting as a virtual assistant, the agent swiftly identifies overdue payments, provides detailed summaries, and recommends actionable next steps, transforming traditional analysis into strategic decision-making. It offers comprehensive insights into outstanding balances, open invoices, and disputes, empowering finance teams to improve cash flow management and reduce risk. This innovation allows accountants to focus on proactive financial strategies, enhancing operational efficiency. Stay tuned for the general availability release of this game-changing tool.

 For more details, visit the SAP Help Portal and check out our demo video below.

 

Supply Chain: Optimized warehouse operations with AI-assisted predictive labor demand planning

Speaking of the Supply Chain area, SAP Cloud ERP Private's AI-assisted predictive labor demand planning is enhancing warehouse operations by addressing labor shortages and rising delivery demands with greater confidence. Imagine your warehouse managers equipped to forecast short- and mid-term workload changes using both historical and real-time data. This innovative solution allows for precise planning of resources and workloads, improving efficiency in managing outbound delivery orders.

The tool provides seamless access to interactive charts and key performance indicators (KPIs), helping managers to monitor, analyze, and anticipate labor demand. Integrated with SAP Smart Business, it leverages AI to offer forecasts on planned and future workloads, enabling supervisors to better plan shifts, enhance transparency, and minimize potential delays. As a result, businesses boost customer satisfaction by ensuring timely delivery fulfillment.

 For more details on this solution, visit the SAP Help Portal and watch the demo video below.

 

Service Management: Equipment insights with Joule

In Service Management area, gaining a 360¬∞ view of equipment life cycles can transform your operational approach. With Joule integration, managers can assess equipment details, warranty information, and active service transactions, gaining insights into both customer and vendor warranties. AI-generated summaries capture the nuances of parts replaced and recurring issues, while offering recommendations for proactive management. This depth of information empowers service managers to make informed decisions, streamline operations, and enhance overall equipment effectiveness.

For more details, visit the SAP Help Portal and check out our demo video below.

 

 

Sourcing and Procurement: Purchase requisitions with AI-powered assistance

In the Sourcing and Procurement space, we are happy to introduce AI-assisted self-service requisitioning, simplifying the way purchase requisitions are created. Imagine casual users effortlessly engaging with Joule, an intuitive assistant that streamlines data entry and intelligently interprets misspelled information. This makes the requisition process accessible and user-friendly, eliminating the need for extensive navigation through multiple interfaces. Beyond just simplifying data input, Joule also leverages advanced language processing to understand and facilitate requests in diverse user languages, enhancing accuracy and efficiency. As a glimpse into the future, speech recognition promises to further reduce complexity, while simultaneously supporting purchasers by identifying sources of supply swiftly and minimizing reliance on free text items.

 Eager to learn more? Consult our SAP Help Portal.

 

Sales: Resolving sales order fulfillment challenges with AI assistance

In the sales area, SAP Cloud ERP Private introduces an AI-assisted sales order fulfillment process with Joule, designed to seamlessly address delivery, invoice, and supply challenges. Imagine having an assistant that not only identifies but explains the intricacies of fulfillment issues, spanning incomplete data, credit holds, billing discrepancies, and trade compliance blocks. As questions arise, Joule provides clear, AI-generated explanations of interconnected issues, displayed in an intuitive carousel format. Beyond resolving queries, it supports inquiries about supply chain and invoicing problems, as well as journal entry creation, making the entire process more transparent and manageable. This innovative tool streamlines sales operations, ensuring smoother transactions and greater clarity.

For further insights, explore the SAP Help Portal.

Now, let‚Äôs explore further innovations of the current release across various lines of business.

 

Turning data into value: A unified data foundation with SAP Business Data Cloud

In today‚Äôs enterprise landscape, data is the engine of transformation. With SAP Business Data Cloud, organizations can unify and govern their most valuable data ‚Äì across SAP and third-party sources ‚Äì enabling real-time insights and smarter decisions at every level. 

 

A unified data foundation for every business need

SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 delivers seamless integration with SAP Business Data Cloud, providing a governed, harmonized data layer that supports analytics, planning, and AI-driven innovation. This foundation breaks down silos and ensures that leaders have access to trusted, business-ready data. 

For more information, consult our page on integration with SAP Business Data Cloud.

Industry-ready data products

The release introduces a broad set of data products tailored for diverse business scenarios:

  • Convergent invoicing: Data products for billing requests, plans, and documents enable near-real-time analytics and interactive dashboards.
  • Contract accounting: Rich data products for contract accounts, provider contracts, and accounting documents support deeper financial analysis.
  • Subscription management: Data products for subscription orders, contracts, and agreements provide actionable insights for recurring revenue models.
  • Manufacturing: Unified manufacturing data ‚Äì such as production orders, confirmations, and work centers ‚Äì empowers leaders to optimize operations. Eager to learn more on manufacturing data products? Consult our SAP Help portal.
  • Product lifecycle management: Enhanced data products for bills of material, engineering change masters, and change records drive better product and change management. For more information, click here.

For the information on all released data products, please refer to Business Accelerator Hub. 

 

From data to action: Working capital dashboard

A standout example is the working capital dashboard for SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud. By leveraging harmonized data from finance, procurement, and supply chain, this dashboard gives finance leaders real-time visibility into cash flow, receivables, and payables ‚Äì enabling proactive, data-driven decisions to optimize working capital.

 

SAP Business Data Cloud is not just a technology layer ‚Äì it‚Äôs the strategic enabler that turns data into value, powering the next wave of business transformation.

 

Strengthening the core: Innovations in business applications

 

Finance

Taulia: Contributing to cash flow and supply chain resilience 

Additionally, SAP Cloud ERP Private's integration with SAP Taulia benefits cash flow optimization and supply chain resilience. By leveraging real-time data insights, businesses enhance cash management and strengthen supplier relationships, allowing precise management of early payments and discounts. This boosts liquidity, enabling reinvestment in growth while maintaining supply chain stability. The integration streamlines financial processes, fostering transparency and a robust dialogue between buyers and suppliers. Empowered to manage cash flow proactively and reduce risks, organizations achieve greater agility and resilience.

 For more insights, explore SAP Help Portal.

 

Supply Chain

Streamlining order management with aATP Innovation

The current release introduces important enhancements to the Advanced Available-to-Promise (aATP) capabilities, designed to make order management more intelligent and efficient. These capabilities aim to instill confidence in order confirmations while simultaneously reducing inventory carrying costs, delivering tangible business benefits from the outset.

Picture a business environment where timely delivery is key to customer satisfaction and brand reputation. The new features enable companies to confirm orders with confidence, capitalizing on advanced backorder processing. This flexibility allows users to bypass traditional constraints such as Product Availability Check (PAC), Product Allocation (PAL), and Supply Protection (SUP). As a result, businesses can reliably and accurately fulfill customer needs, ensuring the loyalty that comes from dependable service.

The innovation further streamlines logistics by automating transport order creation, facilitating the smooth movement of stock from substitute locations to the requested site. This automation reduces the need for manual intervention, minimizing errors, and promoting a seamless logistics process. Imagine the operational relief this brings, letting companies dedicate resources to strategic tasks rather than repetitive logistics management.

By introducing efficient availability checks for configured and long products, businesses achieve effective inventory management. This ensures readiness aligns perfectly with demand, paving the way for higher fulfillment rates and precise delivery dates, enhancing overall customer satisfaction.

Additionally, we are happy to introduce the Alternative-Based Confirmation with Stock Transport Document Creation, a feature designed to streamline and improve logistical processes. This innovation allows businesses to consolidate shipments by ensuring that sales order items ship from the originally requested location rather than alternative stock-holding sites. This is particularly beneficial in maintaining a consistent supply chain, reducing the chances of logistical errors.

In the context of international shipping, this feature proves invaluable. It ensures goods are consolidated at locations best suited for tariff and tax declarations, thereby facilitating smoother, compliant export processes. Companies can navigate complex export requirements more confidently, knowing that their logistical operations support rather than hinder compliance.

 

Activation of this feature is notably flexible, accommodating various sales order characteristics. It automates stock reservations and generates necessary transportation documents as the orders are saved, reducing the manual workload associated with these tasks. This automation enhances the accuracy of transportation planning and scheduling, ensuring that these tasks align perfectly with business needs.

Eager to learn more? Consult this dedicated page  on SAP Help portal.

 

Service Management

Enhancing internal logistics: Optimized management of in-house service objects

Additionally, we are introducing a noteworthy advancement with the intracompany logistics feature for in-house service objects. This functionality empowers businesses to efficiently manage service objects within the same company code, enhancing logistical operations and resource utilization. It allows for the seamless transfer of an in-house service object between plants or storage locations, utilizing existing customer stock effectively. This capability not only optimizes space and resources but also streamlines internal logistics processes, ensuring service objects are handled with increased precision.

Businesses can now define and display the plant and storage locations of service objects, providing clearer visibility and control over inventory management. Furthermore, receiving service objects is made more efficient through the introduction of options to receive them directly via inbound delivery. This directly addresses the need for improved logistical coordination within companies, facilitating a more synchronized workflow when handling service objects.

Choosing between customer stock B and returns order stock E offers flexibility in how service objects are managed based on specific business requirements. The graphical process flow provides access to logistics-related documents, helping users quickly ascertain the status and movement of service objects. Additionally, receiving service objects at specified plant or storage locations, and reviewing their current location on the UI, enhances day-to-day operational efficiency and accuracy.

For more details, explore the SAP Help portal.

 

Driving agility: Real-time service management with enhanced service transactions

In today's dynamic business environment, flexibility is paramount for companies looking to stay competitive. In the current release, we introduce one more subtle yet powerful enhancement to service management area: the integration of plant and storage location fields within service transaction items. This advancement isn‚Äôt just a technical upgrade; it's a strategic lever for businesses aiming to enhance their operational agility.

Imagine a scenario where your company needs to rapidly adjust service delivery due to sudden market changes or resource constraints. With these new capabilities, changing the plant and storage location directly in service transactions becomes seamless, enabling you to adapt your logistics in real-time. This flexibility means that resources can be reallocated swiftly, improving response times and aligning services more closely with customer expectations.

Such adaptability transforms how businesses manage their logistics, turning service operations into a strategic advantage rather than a mere necessity. The ability to dynamically adjust service parameters according to evolving business needs not only streamlines processes but also ensures that service delivery remains efficient and customer-centric.

To dive into further details, don‚Äôt hesitate to explore the SAP Help portal page.

 

Asset Management

Streamlined maintenance strategies: Enhancing asset health

In the realm of asset management, SAP Cloud ERP Private introduces the beta version of enhancements with Maintenance Planner and Maintenance Order Management, integrating seamlessly with Joule to improve how maintenance is orchestrated. Consider a planner working hand-in-hand with an intelligent agent, dynamically analyzing real-time data to fine-tune maintenance schedules and improve asset health. Joule leverages technical object details to create maintenance planning buckets, offering planners a clear view of upcoming events and enabling seamless assignment of orders and notifications. Additionally, by checking available slots and reserving production capacities for future operations, downtime is minimized, fostering a more proactive maintenance approach. This integrated system not only optimizes workflows but empowers teams to make informed decisions, ensuring that assets remain in prime condition.

For more details, explore the SAP Help Portal.

 

Optimizing asset management: Tailored efficiency in maintenance operations

In the asset management landscape, SAP Cloud ERP Private enhances the ‚ÄúManage Maintenance Orders‚Äù app to empower businesses with greater efficiency and customization. Imagine a streamlined operation where you effortlessly customize fields and processes to fit your unique needs. This app now allows batch editing of maintenance orders and the inclusion of multiple task lists, simplifying complex workflows and maximizing resource utilization. Picture the ease of linking business partners directly to orders, ensuring transparency and fostering stronger collaborations. This enhanced visibility ensures smoother communication and stronger partnerships, ultimately leading to improved service delivery and outcomes.

Interested to learn more? Click here!

 

 

Sourcing and Procurement

Precision in procurement: Elevating efficiency with synchronized service timelines

In the context of SAP procurement, timing is everything. SAP Cloud ERP Private‚Äôs latest enhancement allows for seamless transfer of lean service start and end dates to connected backend systems, shifting the focus from traditional delivery dates to precise service durations.

Visualize a scenario where procurement teams can boost efficiency significantly by having accurate service timelines at their disposal. This synchronization ensures that everyone, from procurement officers to backend users, operates with the same timeline data, reducing discrepancies and enhancing planning accuracy. With this new capability, businesses gain a strategic advantage, as coordinated planning between departments becomes the norm rather than the exception.

Think of the impact on your business: with synchronized service data, your teams can efficiently coordinate with service providers, ensuring that every commitment is met with precision. This results in improved operational harmony and more reliable partnerships. This innovative feature boosts your procurement efficiency, aligning strategic objectives with everyday operations. For more details on how this can transform your processes, explore the linked page.  

 

Sales

Enhancing sales efficiency with one-step-payment

In the ever-evolving landscape of digital commerce, SAP Cloud ERP Private now empowers businesses to streamline their sales processes through pre-order payments. This innovation allows customers to make payments even before a sales order is created, seamlessly integrating payment details into the sales order via an API. By carrying over liability and payment details to the finance application, businesses can efficiently match liabilities against payments, simplifying settlements and reducing days sales outstanding (DSO). This enhancement not only enhances liquidity and reduces financing costs but also appeals to customers who prefer paying upfront, offering a more flexible purchasing experience. Furthermore, it facilitates faster incoming digital payments, reassuring customers with the stability and responsiveness of a modern finance system.

Want to learn more about Payment Processing? Check out our SAP Help Portal.

 

Manufacturing

Seamless production alignment with advanced MRP solutions

In a quest to enhance operational efficiency, we are introducing innovative features for Material Requirements Planning (MRP) in Manufacturing area. The Accept MRP Run Result functionality allows production planners to flag specific segments as processed, streamlining decision-making by focusing on issues that truly need attention. This improvement, coupled with the ability to use a new filter field, empowers end users to efficiently analyze material coverage for thousands of materials daily, marking a significant enhancement in workflow efficiency. Additionally, the Manage Material Coverage app now offers rescheduling proposals, enabling planners to realign MRP elements by rescheduling or canceling as necessary. These real-time adjustments ensure that manufacturing requirements are always met as planned, minimizing disruptions and maintaining smooth production flows. With the option to invoke or revoke MRP results, businesses gain flexibility in their planning processes, adapting swiftly to changing demands. Ultimately, this upgrade facilitates a more agile and responsive manufacturing environment, ensuring that production aligns seamlessly with demand predictions.

 

For more details, explore the our dedicated pages on accept planning result of MRP run and rescheduling proposals for MRP elements.    

 

Cross Topics

Enhancing business engagement through integrated communications

With the current release, SAP Cloud ERP Private improves organizations‚Äô ability to craft and deliver personalized, traceable communications seamlessly within their existing workflows. This innovation ensures consistent and timely interactions with business contacts by setting up automated, multi-step communication flows that operate both regularly and in response to specific events. By allowing ad-hoc communications directly from the current process step, businesses maintain critical context without ever leaving the system. This not only enhances productivity and transparency but also significantly boosts customer satisfaction by providing tailored communication that meets the unique needs of each business partner. With these capabilities, organizations can foster stronger relationships industry-wide, ensuring every message is delivered effectively and efficiently.

 

For more insights, please refer to SAP Help Portal.

 

Elevating master data governance with Joule copilot

In the quest for seamless data management, SAP introduces an innovation that empowers business users to engage with business partner data through natural language dialogs in Joule Copilot. This advancement provides a consumer-grade user experience, simplifying the processes of searching, displaying, creating, and modifying data within SAP Master Data Governance. By integrating this intuitive interaction capability, users can effortlessly participate in master data processing, enhancing both their effectiveness and the overall speed of data governance. The automation and ease of use offered by Joule Copilot significantly elevate the handling of business partner data, allowing businesses to maintain accurate and timely records with minimal effort. This innovation stands as a testament to the commitment to user-friendly technology that aligns with modern business needs.

 

Simplifying process check complexities with Joule copilot

Moreover, the integration of Joule copilot, helps tackling the complexity of the data governance processes by laying bare with the simplicity of natural language dialog. From now on, users can seamlessly search for and display governance processes in cloud-ready mode, including vital approval information. There's no need for extensive training or additional tools, business users can now harness advanced functions within SAP Master Data Governance intuitively. This empowerment transforms how teams interact with data, enabling them to make informed decisions swiftly and accurately. By simplifying the understanding of governance processes, businesses can ensure compliance and streamline operations.

 

Improved user experience: Seamless navigation with WalkMe integration

Imagine having a virtual guide that not only navigates the complexities of SAP Cloud ERP Private edition but boosts efficiency and confidence. Integrating WalkMe with SAP Cloud ERP Private improves user engagement by offering intuitive in-app guidance akin to a personal assistant, easing the learning curve for new users. This seamless interaction accelerates software adoption, reducing training time and automating repetitive tasks for heightened efficiency. As users navigate system upgrades or new processes, WalkMe‚Äôs role-specific guidance ensures confidence and competence, thereby transforming potential challenges into manageable steps. By providing actionable insights into user behavior, WalkMe empowers users to resolve issues independently, which enhances IT efficiency and reduces support demands.

 

Register for the SAP Business Suite Product Expert Training 2025!

The SAP Business Suite Product Expert Training is a biannual multi-day event designed to empower partners with in-depth knowledge of the latest features and AI-driven innovations. 

For the first time, we‚Äôre covering the full range of SAP Business Suite, incl. topics such as SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC), Spend Management, Supply Chain Management (SCM), Customer Experience (CX), Human Capital Management (HCM), and more, setting a new benchmark in SAP training.

Join this event to maximize customer success and stay ahead of the rapidly evolving digital landscape.

  • From October 6-17, we cover SAP Cloud ERP, Cloud LoB, and SAP SCM
  • From October 27-31, we cover SAP Cloud ERP Private, Cloud LoB, and SAP SCM

Check out the detailed agenda on this landing page and register now. Please take into consideration that the registration is available for partners and internal SAP employees only. 

 

Summary

As we explore the SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release, it's impressive to see how these innovations integrate advanced technology with intelligent business processes. From enhancing finance management to improving supply chain operations and service quality, these advancements are designed to support companies in the future.

I encourage you to delve deeper into the specific business and industry-focused innovations in upcoming blog posts. Connect with us on our community page to engage with our experts, raise your queries, and share insights.

Stay ahead by following the latest updates with the PSCC_Enablement tag. Don't forget to follow me at BeSchulze in the community and on LinkedIn to catch all the updates and insights.

Together, let's work towards a more connected and efficient ERP future.

Best wishes,
Bert

entry.title: Master Data In SAP Plant Maintenance
entry.content:
In SAP we have two different types of data namely:- 

  • Master Data
  • Transactional Data 

For any person who is working in the SAP should know about what is transactional data and what are master data. Because each of the module have different types of master data and different transactional data in SAP.

Master Data:-

The data which is created and cannot be changed frequently it means once the data is being created in the system then this data will be accessed frequently but the changes to this data will not being done.

Example:- Materials, Equipments, Functional Location, Permits, source list, Purchase info Record, Customer Info Record etc.. .

Transactional Data:-

The data which is created based on master data it means that this data will be created upon by using the master data components.

Example:- Notifications, Maintenance Orders, Work Order confirmations, Sales orders, Purchase Orders etc.... 

Master data Components in SAP Plant Maintenance:- 

1. Functional Location:- we use Functional Location in SAP PM to identify where the technical object equipment is being installed. It is mainly used to prioritize the maintenance technician to find the equipment or machine that is being installed in a Plant.

Main components of functional location :-  Structure Indicator , Edit mask, Hierarchy Levels

2. Equipment:- Equipment is one of the type of technical object in which we will create machines that are being used in production to manufacture the finished goods.

3.Serial Numbers:- Serial numbers is considered as master data as it means same specifications machines will be installed in the plant right so serial numbers is master data. And this is the point where the SAP PM integrates SAP MM(Material Management).

4. Work Center:- A group of people who are responsible for work is known as work center. Mostly in the naming convention will be ELECXXXX or MECHXXX. It means that the department with number convention is mostly being used in sap.

5.Bill Of Materials:- BOM is being used in various departments like production , sales etc... but when it comes to plant maintenance it is used as the materials that are needed to maintain the equipment or material that are being used in equipment reference purpose. For more information about Bill Of materials navigate to the link below:-

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-members/bill-of-materials-bom/ba-p/14145696 

6.Maintenance Plan:- A plan is created which will generate the orders, notifications, Service Procurement etc.. based on scheduling parameters.

7. Catalogs & Code Groups:- It is a integration part in SAP PM with SAP QM. Catalogs Profile is given by the Quality Management team in which we have code groups. In Code groups they will maintain the object parts that are present in the equipment , cause and damage of equipment parts etc.... 

8.Measuring Points & Counter:- Measuring points and counter plays a crucial role in Equipments as they were used for maintaining the recording or readings of equipment after using them. For example : Micrometer, thermometer etc....

9.Task List:- The tasks that are being executed every time or else we can tell as like the tasks that needs to be performed are listed in a structured format.
There are 3 types of task list in plant maintenance namely

  • Equipment task list: - This is mainly used for equipments only. The tasks that are required for needed to be done for the equipment.
  • Functional Location Task List: - This is mainly used for specific functional locations in which the tasks are to be performed.
  • General Task List: - This will be created for general purpose, reusable resources, across multiple equipments as well as functional locations.

10.Material Master:- Material master is also considered as master data in sap pm because the materials that are required for maintaining the equipment or the materials.

11. Employee Master Data:- Employee master data in which the assignment of employee for technical object or else the assignment of employee for work center etc.. are being assigned and these employee id and employee creation will be done by human capital management system(HCM). This is an integration point where the module HCM integrate with PM.

Transactional Data:-

1. Notification:- Notification is created whenever any maintenance is required for equipment or malfunction is being held at an equipment. Then to notify the persons in the plant they will create the notification by using of master data.

2. Work Order/Maintenance Order: - The materials which are required for maintenance activities will be assigned here in the maintenance order. For cost collection purpose it means the activities or task that are being done by a maintenance technician will be collected here. 

3. Confirmation: - The activities that are being carried out by the maintenance technician will be confirmed by the production supervisor or else the production department who is working at the machines or equipments.

4. Settlement Of Maintenance Order/ Production Order: - Generally this will be carried out by the FICO team but the settlement of an order can be done after performing the TECO or else the order cannot be settled. Here the settlement will be done against order otherwise the cost that are being collected in the maintenance order will not be posted to the cost elements. These cost elements will not post the costs to the g/l accounts which are present in the Finance accounts.

5. Measurement Documents: - These are the documents that keeps on changing whenever there is a use of equipments like PRT tools, or else any meters that are being used for checking the equipments. The values will be entered while performing the confirmation in IW41.

DATA UPLOAD SEQUENCE IN SAP:- 
So for suppose you are working on the implementation project and wanted to upload the master data so we will just follow the below sequence, It is best sequence as per  my knowledge.

Summary:- 

In every SAP module, both master data and transactional data play a crucial role in executing business processes. Earlier, I explained these two types of data in detail for SAP Plant Maintenance.

For example, in the SAP MM (Materials Management) module, the master data includes elements such as Material Master, Source List, Purchase Info Record, Service Master, and Vendor Master. The transactional data in MM involves activities like Purchase Order (PO), MIGO (Goods Receipt), and MIRO (Invoice Verification).

Similarly, in the SAP SD (Sales and Distribution) module, the master data consists of Pricing Conditions, Sales Organization, Division, Sales Area, and Shipping Point.

In short, every SAP module has its own specific master and transactional data, which together ensure smooth and integrated business operations across the system.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: SAP Business Data Cloud: Data products, master data, governance
entry.content:
Dear Data-Enthusiasts!

Are you still unsure how your data management approach can benefit of SAP Business Data Cloud, what data products are, and which advantages SAP-managed data products bring?

Then you might want to attend our session SAP Business Data Cloud: Data products, master data, and governance (DA100) at SAP TechEd in Berlin on Tuesday, Nov 4 at 9:30 AM.

Besides the questions above, we will also discuss the role of SAP Master Data Governance and how to use it for improved data quality, analytics, and AI.

We are Florian Neukirch @FlorianN and Andreas Seifried @AndreasSeifried, looking forward meeting you during and after our lecture!

Florian is a Senior Product Management Specialist for SAP BDC&I. His focus is on Data Products, Catalog, Marketplace and Data Product Governance. Florian started his career at SAP in Solution Management and has taken over several roles in the SAP BDC&I organization since then.

Andreas is a product manager for SAP Master Data Governance and is engaged in shaping SAP‚Äôs portfolio for data management since he joined the development organization in 2004. Andreas started at SAP as a technology consultant in 2001, when he helped organizations all over the world to solve their data and process integration challenges.

We will introduce you to the concept of data products and explore how SAP-managed data products can enhance your data architecture. We'll delve into the significance of master data for analytics, processes, and AI, and discuss upcoming features like the data product studio.

Other related sessions that we recommend:

  • DA203 | SAP Business Data Cloud: The path forward for SAP Business Warehouse by @kpsauer and @kurzdo93 
  • DA266 | Operationalizing AI with SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud by @san_tran 

Related community topic pages:

SAP Master Data Governance | SAP Community

SAP Business Data Cloud | SAP Community

SAP Datasphere | SAP Community

Looking forward to seeing you in Berlin!

Florian and Andreas

 

Now let‚Äôs hear from you:

  • What are your experiences with SAP Business Data Cloud and SAP Master Data Governance?
  • Is it valid to have distinct views on (generic) data management and master data management? What are the reasons?

Please add your thoughts as comments to this blog. Thanks!

entry.title: SAP MDG: Assign Roles Automatically According to CR Type
entry.content:
Hi SCN Folks, 

Hope you guys are doing great üôÇ

Note 01: This blog does not include execution screenshots.
Note 02: The entire code was developed and validated in the SANDBOX system, with results meeting expectations.
Note 03: There are several ways; this blog is written about one of them.

Create one custom class & redefine the standard class (CL_MDG_BS_ECC_HANDLER)

Method Responsible: IF_MDG_BS_BP_ACCESS_HANDLER~DERIVE_DATA

Code:

    DATA : lv_crtype      TYPE usmd_crequest_type,
           lt_bp_role     TYPE TABLE OF /mdgbp/_s_bp_pp_bp_role,
           ls_bp_role     TYPE  /mdgbp/_s_bp_pp_bp_role.

    CONSTANTS lc_crtype TYPE string VALUE 'CRTYPE'.

    DATA(obj_param) = cl_FPM_factory=>get_instance( )->mo_app_parameter.

    CALL METHOD obj_param->get_value
      EXPORTING
        iv_key   = lc_crtype
      IMPORTING
        ev_value = lv_crtype.

    READ TABLE gt_bproot_task ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<ls_bproot_task>) INDEX 1.

    IF <ls_bproot_task> IS ASSIGNED.
      ls_bp_role-bp_header = <ls_bproot_task>-bp_id.

      CASE lv_crtype.
        WHEN 'ZMDGS01'.
          ls_bp_role-bp_rol_id ='FLVN01'.
          ls_bp_role-rol_vfrom = sy-datum.
          ls_bp_role-rol_vto = '99991231'.
          APPEND ls_bp_role TO lt_bp_role.
          ls_bp_role-bp_rol_id ='FLVN00'.
          ls_bp_role-rol_vfrom = sy-datum.
          ls_bp_role-rol_vto = '99991231'.
          APPEND ls_bp_role TO lt_bp_role.
        WHEN 'ZMDGS02'.
          ls_bp_role-bp_rol_id ='FLVN01'.
          ls_bp_role-rol_vfrom = sy-datum.
          ls_bp_role-rol_vto = '99991231'.
          APPEND ls_bp_role TO lt_bp_role.
      ENDCASE.

    ENDIF.

    io_write_data->write_data(
      i_entity     = 'BP_ROLE'
      it_data      = lt_bp_role ).

    me->if_mdg_bs_bp_access_handler~buffer_derived_data(
      io_model        =  io_model
      iv_entity       =  'BP_ROLE'
      it_data_ins     =  lt_bp_role
    ).
    .

 

SAP S/4HANA   SAP Master Data Governance   ABAP Development  

Thank You, 
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Community Profile | SAP Profile | LinkedIn

entry.title: Manage AI DAR in SAP MDG using Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM)
entry.content:
Introduction

In this blog, let us understand how to leverage SAP Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) to manage Generative AI and AI business services in the SAP MDG. This blog mainly focuses on how to use one of the AI Business Services i.e. Data Attribute Recommendation (DAR) in MDG via ISLM.

MDG Scenario

Just taken a simple scenario to showcase of Intelligent Scenario (ISLM) in MDG to derive material Group [MATKL] in MDG change request (CR) based on material type [MTART]. DAR is used to predict the material group from a trained machine learning model by accepting the material type as input from MDG CR using ISLM.

Implementation

1. BTP

First of all, The BTP account is needed to create instance on the AI business service DAR to have machine learning model. If you do not have a BTP account, please refer this link to create a BTP trial account Get an Account on SAP BTP Trial | SAP Tutorials.

you can find the Data Attribute Recommendation (DAR) in the service marketplace to create an instance.

After the instance created for DAR, the service key is to be created which would help to connect to this DAR from MDG via ISLM.

 

Please take a note of this service key which will be used in ISLM connection mapping later.

To simplify the above setup, please refer the below link to use booster to setup the DAR.

Use Trial to Set Up Account for Data Attribute Recommendation and Download Postman Sample Files | SAP Tutorials

Please refer the below links to use postman to create schema and dataset which will be used in prediction class.

Install Postman REST Client | SAP Tutorials

Use Data Attribute Recommendation to Train a Machine Learning Model | SAP Tutorials

 

2. Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) in MDG System

  • ISLM is part of the ABAP Platform offered as core functionality in ABAP stack. 
  • ISLM Framework is developed in SAP BASIS Component from ABAP Platform 2020 delivery with SAP BASIS  755 / 7.8x onwards.
  • ISLM facilitates and helps to consume the Machine learning scenarios with an ABAP based Business Application seamlessly
  • ISLM helps to integrate AI and AI Business services into MDG system (S/4HANA).
  • ISLM offers an end-to-end framework to manage both pre-delivered and custom AI scenarios in SAP S/4HANA.

In this example, would like to walk through custom AI-DAR scenario through ISLM.

The below configuration is to be completed in MDG system to enable ISLM related applications.

  • Setting up the OData Services
  • Setting up the bgRFC Queue
  • Configuring Business Roles for the Backend
  • Configuring Business Roles for the Frontend

Please make sure that role SAP_BR_ANALYTICS_SPECIALIST is assigned to the user which is required to access the below Intelligent Scenario Apps. 

Click on Intelligent Scenarios App to create an intelligent scenario to consume AI business service DAR.

As you may aware, SAP ISLM provides two options as Embedded and Side-by-Side. In this example, would like to cover side-by-side scenario. So, click on create Button to initiate a side-by-side scenario creation.

Enter Scenario Name, Description and Type as Data Attribute Recommendation.

Click on Checkbox Data Management to manage the data provision to ML model from CDS view in MDG system.

It is recommended to use $TMP local package in ISLM until the Intelligent scenario is developed and tested thoroughly. After finalization, create the application package specific intelligent scenario. ISLM creates 'Intelligent Scenario' as an ABAP Object (Transportable / added to a TR based on catalog/package).

Create a prediction class with interface IF_ISLM_INTS_SBS_DAR which will be assigned in the intelligent scenario.

click on Add model after entered data management checkbox, package and prediction class.

Create a CDS view (Z_I_MATDAR) with fields material number [MATNR], material type [MTART] and material group [MATKL] in MDG system to provide data to train DAR machine learning model.

The CDS view Z_I_MATDAR is assigned as training dataset in the model

Input:

Output:

The intelligent scenario could be published after all the above steps are done.

Maintain connection mapping between intelligent scenario and DAR service (BTP) using service key and oAuth profile through the transaction ISLM_CONN_MAP.

 

 

 

 

In the Intelligent scenario management App, the model needs to be trained as well as deployed.

3. Master Data Governance (MDG)

MDG derivation BADI could be used to call the DAR which is configured in ISLM in MDG change request. In the BADI, it will derive material group using DAR from ISLM based on material type in the MDG CR.

Execution

Enter material type in the MDG change request which will derive material group based on AI-DAR service using ISLM.

Conclusion

In this blog post, we have learnt how to derive attributes in the MDG change request using AI business service - Data Attribute Recommendation (DAR) via ISLM.

entry.title: SAP Document AI in SAP MDG using Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM)
entry.content:
Introduction

In this blog, let us understand how to leverage SAP Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) to manage Generative AI and AI business services in the SAP MDG. This blog mainly focuses on how to use one of the AI Business Services i.e. Document AI in MDG via ISLM. It is formerly known as Document Information Extraction (DIE).

MDG Scenario

The scenario is to derive the address details from vendor registration PDF document which will be uploaded in the MDG change request. SAP Document AI from BTP is used to read the details from a PDF document and derive the data into MDG change request.

Implementation

1. BTP

First of all, The BTP account is needed to create instance on the AI business service - SAP Document AI to read data from PDF. If you do not have a BTP account, please refer this link to create a BTP trial account Get an Account on SAP BTP Trial | SAP Tutorials.

You can find the SAP Document AI Trail (DIE) in the service marketplace to create an instance.

Please make sure instance as well as service key is created. The service key is used later in the ISLM connection mapping configuration.

Please subscribe to SAP Document AI UI application

Assign Role Collection to your user in Security.

To simplify all the above setup, you can use Booster as alternative to setup the SAP Document AI in BTP.

PDF Document

Please find sample PDF document which will be used as a document template to setup in the SAP Document AI.

Schema Configuration 

Create a custom schema in SAP Document AI Application to extract fields from PDF document.

Add Header Fields

Add header fields in the custom schema to map with PDF document. All the fields such as FirstName, LastName, House No, Street, postal code etc. from PDF to map with business partner fields in MDG change request.

Activate the schema after all the fields are added.

 

Create Template

Template in SAP Business AI that uses schema and associated document. You could edit the extraction results of the associated documents to teach SAP Document AI where certain field values are located on the document to improve the accuracy of the extraction.

There is no associated document, so we need to add PDF document now in Documents.

Add Document

Add the PDF document in the Documents in SAP Document AI application and map the schema fields with PDF fields.

Add this document to template

Now, click on Add to Template Button to add this document to custom template created in one of the above steps.

Activate template

Access Template on the left navigation pane to activate it.

Now, all the setup related to SAP Document AI is completed.

2. Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) in MDG System

  • ISLM is part of the ABAP Platform offered as core functionality in ABAP stack. 
  • ISLM Framework is developed in SAP BASIS Component from ABAP Platform 2020 delivery with SAP BASIS  755 / 7.8x onwards.
  • ISLM facilitates and helps to consume the Machine learning scenarios with an ABAP based Business Application seamlessly
  • ISLM helps to integrate AI and AI Business services into MDG system (S/4HANA).
  • ISLM offers an end-to-end framework to manage both pre-delivered and custom AI scenarios in SAP S/4HANA.

In this example, would like to walk through custom AI-DAR scenario through ISLM.

The below configuration is to be completed in MDG system to enable ISLM related applications.

  • Setting up the OData Services
  • Setting up the bgRFC Queue
  • Configuring Business Roles for the Backend
  • Configuring Business Roles for the Frontend

Please make sure that role SAP_BR_ANALYTICS_SPECIALIST is assigned to the user which is required to access the below Intelligent Scenario Apps. 

 

Click on Intelligent Scenarios App to create an intelligent scenario to consume AI business service SAP Document AI (DIE).

As you may aware, SAP ISLM provides two options as Embedded and Side-by-Side. In this example, would like to cover side-by-side scenario. So, click on create Button to initiate a side-by-side scenario creation.

 

Enter Scenario Name, Description and Type as Document Information Extraction.

It is recommended to use $TMP local package in ISLM until the Intelligent scenario is developed and tested thoroughly. After finalization, create the application package specific intelligent scenario. ISLM creates 'Intelligent Scenario' as an ABAP Object (Transportable / added to a TR based on catalog/package).

Create a prediction class with interface IF_ISLM_INTS_SBS_DOCX which will be assigned in the intelligent scenario.

The intelligent scenario could be published after all the above steps are done.

Maintain connection mapping between intelligent scenario and SAP Document AI (DIE) service (BTP) using service key and oAuth profile through the transaction ISLM_CONN_MAP.

In the Intelligent scenario management App, the deployment of intelligent scenario needs to be activated.

3. Master Data Governance (MDG)

In MDG, Cross entity derivation BADI could be used to call the Document AI via ISLM in MDG change request. In the BADI, it will read the name and address details using Document AI from PDF, which is attached in the MDG CR, and it will derive this information in the CR.

Execution

To execute this scenario, attach the PDF document in the MDG CR header and select BP grouping in the CR, it will trigger the BADI to derive the name and address details from PDF to MDG change request.

The file name and file title could be any and it is not fixed to any particular name.

Now, the name and address details are derived in the CR from PDF document.

Conclusion

In this blog post, we have learnt how to derive fields in the MDG change request from PDF document using SAP Document AI via ISLM.

entry.title: SAP MDG: Locking Supplier General Data When Data Already exists
entry.content:
Hi SCN Folks, 

Hope you guys are doing great üôÇ

Note 01: This blog does not include execution screenshots.
Note 02: The entire code was developed and validated in the SANDBOX system, with results meeting expectations.
Note 03: There are several ways to implement; this blog is written about one of them.

Create one custom class & redefine the standard class (CL_MDG_BS_ECC_HANDLER)

Method Responsible: IF_MDG_BS_BP_ACCESS_HANDLER~GET_ENTITY_PROPERTIES.

DATA: lv_crequest_type TYPE usmd_crequest_type,
      lv_cr_number     TYPE usmd_crequest,
      lo_app_context   TYPE REF TO if_usmd_app_context.

DATA: lo_data      TYPE REF TO data,
      lt_data      TYPE usmd_ts_data_entity,
      lt_msg       TYPE usmd_t_message,
      ls_msg       TYPE usmd_s_message,
      lt_erp_v     TYPE REF TO data.

FIELD-SYMBOLS:
      <lt_erpv> TYPE SORTED TABLE,
      <ls_erpv> TYPE any,
      <lv_erpv> TYPE any.

CALL METHOD cl_usmd_app_context=>get_context
  RECEIVING
    eo_context = lo_app_context.

IF lo_app_context IS BOUND.

  CALL METHOD lo_app_context->get_attributes
    IMPORTING
      ev_crequest_id   = lv_cr_number
      ev_crequest_type = lv_crequest_type
      ev_process       = lv_process.

  lv_crequest_type = iv_crequest_type.

  CALL METHOD super->if_mdg_bs_bp_access_handler~get_entity_properties
    EXPORTING
      iv_entity         = iv_entity
      is_key            = is_key
      io_model          = io_model
      iv_crequest_type  = iv_crequest_type
      iv_crequest_step  = iv_crequest_step
      iv_crequest_index = iv_crequest_index
    CHANGING
      cf_read_only      = cf_read_only.

  IF iv_crequest_type EQ 'ZMDGS03'.
    io_model->read_entity_data_all(
      EXPORTING
        i_fieldname      = 'BP_HEADER'
        if_active        = abap_false
        i_crequest       = lv_cr_number
      IMPORTING
        et_message       = lt_msg
        et_data_entity   = lt_data
    ).

    lt_erp_v = VALUE #(
      lt_data[ usmd_entity      = 'BP_HEADER'
               usmd_entity_cont = 'BP_VENGEN'
               struct           = 'KATTR' ]-r_t_data OPTIONAL ).

    IF lt_erp_v IS NOT INITIAL.
      IF iv_entity EQ 'BP_VENGEN'.
        cf_read_only = 'X'.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
  ENDIF.

ENDIF.

SAP S/4HANA   SAP Master Data Governance   ABAP Development  

Thank You, 
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Community Profile | SAP Profile | LinkedIn

entry.title: A clear guide to understanding how SAP MDG prioritizes UI layers‚Äîstandard, CBA, customization, and e
entry.content:
When working with SAP Master Data Governance (MDG), it‚Äôs common to face situations where a field behaves differently than expected ‚Äî maybe it‚Äôs hidden for one user role but visible for another, or a layout change doesn‚Äôt appear. These issues often come down to how different UI layers interact with each other.

To make sense of it, let‚Äôs walk through how SAP MDG decides which configuration takes effect when you use standard setup, CBA, customization, and enhancements.

Standard Configuration ‚Äì The Starting Point

Every MDG screen begins with the standard SAP configuration. This includes the delivered Floorplan Manager (FPM) setup, feeder classes, and event logic. Think of this as the foundation. Everything else ‚Äî from customizations to enhancements ‚Äî builds on top of it.

Context-Based Adaptation (CBA)

CBA allows you to adapt the UI depending on the context ‚Äî such as a business role, change request type, or entity type. If more than one CBA applies, the system picks the one with the highest priority (defined by the lowest numeric value in customizing). CBA runs before any runtime logic and overrides the standard configuration. It‚Äôs the best option when you want different screens or layouts for different user roles or processes.

UI Customization

Once the relevant configuration (standard or CBA) is loaded, the system applies any UI customizations you‚Äôve made. These are the changes you do in the FPM configuration editor ‚Äî for example, hiding a field, changing labels, or adjusting layout groups. If both a CBA and a customization touch the same field, the CBA takes priority because it decides which version of the configuration is active.

UI Enhancements

After all the configuration-based layers are applied, enhancements come into play. These are ABAP-based runtime changes done through custom logic or BadIs. Enhancements have the highest priority because they run at runtime and can override anything set in configuration or CBA. For example, even if a field is hidden in CBA, an enhancement can make it visible again based on business rules.

Summary of Priority

Priority| Layer| What It Does

  1. (Lowest)| Standard Configuration: SAP-delivered default setup
  2. CBA: Adjusts UI based on context (role, CR type, etc.)
  3. UI Customization: Static FPM-level changes
  4. (Highest)| UI Enhancements: Dynamic ABAP logic at runtime

 

Best Practice:

  1. Use CBA for context-based variations (like role or process-specific screens).
  2. Use UI Customization for layout or field visibility changes that stay constant.
  3. Use Enhancements for dynamic, condition-based logic at runtime.

 

Understanding this order helps avoid conflicts between configurations and ensures your MDG UI behaves consistently. It also makes your design easier to maintain and extend as your governance processes evolve.

entry.title: Why clean data is the foundation of enterprise success
entry.content:
Why clean data is the foundation of enterprise success

We‚Äôve all been there: reports that don‚Äôt align, systems that refuse to speak the same language, and data that seems to have a mind of its own. It‚Äôs frustrating, time-consuming, and costly. Unclean data doesn‚Äôt just cause confusion - it multiplies complexity. It clogs business processes, drives up the number of upgrade cycles, and makes every transformation effort harder than it needs to be. And these aren‚Äôt just data quality issues - they‚Äôre symptoms of a fragmented data foundation that slows progress and limits innovation.

Now imagine a world where every decision is powered by data that just works: accurate, consistent, governed, and seamlessly connected across the enterprise. That‚Äôs what clean data makes possible. It‚Äôs the quiet engine behind transformation -the unseen force that fuels trust, agility, and innovation.

Clean data turns chaos into clarity. It enables governed, reusable data products built on shared semantics and harmonized master and reference data - so information flows freely across domains, analytics deliver truth instead of noise, and AI scales with confidence. Building on this foundation, the clean core approach takes the next step - transforming data clarity into business agility. It helps organizations unlock the full power of intelligent, connected operations by relying on harmonized, semantically linked data. When processes are standardized around proven best practices and strategic extensions are enabled for differentiation, businesses gain the agility to evolve without complexity.

With SAP Business Suite at the center, this approach keeps systems current, fuels continuous innovation, and paves the way for faster adoption of AI - turning trusted data into a true engine of transformation.

The business power of clean data

Clean data is more than a technical concern - it‚Äôs a true business enabler. By embedding clean data practices into the core of your enterprise, you can unlock:

  • Trustworthy decision-making ‚Äì ensure leaders can rely on accurate, consistent information at every level of the business.
  • Regulatory confidence ‚Äì meet compliance requirements seamlessly with transparent, auditable data.
  • AI and automation readiness ‚Äì create the reliable foundation required to scale advanced analytics, automation, and intelligent technologies.
  • Operational excellence ‚Äì reduce inefficiencies caused by data errors, rework, and duplication, freeing teams to focus on higher-value outcomes.

 

Clean core data whitepaper

That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm excited to introduce our new Clean core data whitepaper, designed for organizations moving from ERP to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. This paper explores how to make this vision a reality. Inside, you‚Äôll find practical guidance on implementing clean data practices, sustaining them at scale, and unlocking the full potential of your enterprise data.

A sneak preview of what‚Äôs inside

Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôll find inside:

  • The five pillars of clean core data  - explore the essential dimensions of clean data: strategy, governance, quality, volume efficiency, and protection - each designed to strengthen your enterprise data foundation.
  • A practical measurement framework -  learn how to assess data maturity and governance using KPIs aligned with the RISE with SAP Methodology and dashboard.
  • Operationalizing the data product economy - discover how to leverage SAP Business Data Cloud and SAP Master Data Governance to deliver governed, reusable, and high-value data products.
  • Harmonizing SAP and non-SAP data - See how a unified semantic layer ensures interoperability and consistency, while keeping custom extensions decoupled on SAP BTP.
  • Driving seamless upgrades and intelligent insights - gain guidance on reducing infrastructure complexity, minimizing technical debt, and fueling trustworthy AI and analytics with a clean, future-ready data core.

Each chapter of the whitepaper takes you deeper into the journey:

  1. Building a clean core: Overcoming data chaos for a modern, compliant enterprise
  2. Chart the path to your clean data vision: Leverage clean core data to achieve business success
  3. Data framework: Dive deep into the building blocks of clean core data
  4. The cornerstones of a clean core data architecture

 Driving data confidence with the RISE with SAP Methodology

Every successful digital transformation starts with one question: how do we turn data into continuous business value? Within the clean data framework, the answer begins with the RISE with SAP Methodology. It provides a clear roadmap, guiding organizations from identifying data challenges to building, monitoring, and scaling a sustainable clean data strategy. Through automated clean data KPIs, organizations can track the state of their data in real time - across both projects and day-to-day operations. All of this comes together in the RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard, offering a unified view of data health, performance, and progress toward true data-driven agility.

Ready to take the first step?

Clean data is not a one-time project - it‚Äôs a journey and a discipline. The first step is to explore the Whitepaper on clean data and see how organizations can establish a foundation for smarter decisions, efficient operations, and long-term resilience.

üëâ Download the Clean core data whitepaper

entry.title: Extending Standard SAP MDG Data Model (MM) with Custom Fields
entry.content:
This blog is based on our practical experience and learnings from a recent SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) project. We had a requirement to extend the standard SAP MDG Data Model (MM) with custom fields at both Plant and Sales levels.

To achieve this, there are two main approaches available:

  1. Traditional Approach
  2. In-App Extensibility

1. Traditional Approach : Using the traditional approach, adding a custom field requires multiple manual extensions across different layers of the SAP system ‚Äî including:

  • Database tables (e.g., MARC, MVKE)
  • CDS views
  • SOA services
  • OData APIs

During our implementation, while extending the MARC table with a custom field, we encountered the following error:

DBSQL_REDIRECT_INCONSISTENCY ‚Äì A table could not be redirected

SAP has already addressed this issue in SAP Note 2242679 ‚Äì Redirect inconsistency ‚Äì Proxy Substitution, which suggests executing the report NSDM_PROXY_SUBSTITUTION for the MARC table to adjust the related CDS view and resolve the inconsistency.

Although this resolves the immediate technical issue, the traditional approach still requires repetitive manual work ‚Äî extending the field individually at every layer (database, CDS, SOAP, and OData). This process is not only time-consuming but also prone to inconsistencies.

2. In-App Extensibility (Custom Fields and Logic)

To overcome these challenges, we adopted the In-App Extensibility approach using the Fiori app ‚Äî Custom Fields and Logic.

This approach allows you to add and manage custom fields in a single step. When a field is created via this app, it can automatically extend the following components (depending on your configuration and enablement):

  • Underlying database tables
  • Relevant CDS views
  • SOAP services
  • OData APIs

This provides a one-stop solution for extending standard SAP objects ‚Äî significantly simplifying the process and reducing development effort.

Extensibility Steps (Using In-App Extensibility)

Follow the steps below to create and enable a custom field using the Fiori App ‚Äì Custom Fields and Logic.

  • Open the Custom Fields and Logic app.

  • Click on the ‚Äú+ (Create)‚Äù button to add a new custom field.

Enter all the necessary information such as:

  • Business Context
  • Label
  • Data Type
  • Length

Select the services across different tabs where you want to make this custom field available (e.g., Database Table, SOAP Service, OData API, etc.). 

 

Click Save to save your configuration.

Click on Publish to enable the custom field.

The publishing process may take a few minutes. Once completed, the field‚Äôs status will change to ‚ÄúPublished.‚Äù

After publishing:

  • Check the database table (e.g., MARC or MVKE) to ensure the new field is added.

  • Verify that the field is available in the corresponding SOAP service.

  • Verify that the field is available in the corresponding MDC Model.

Note: The Data Model Extension process in MDG remains unchanged. You must still follow the standard MDG extension procedure as detailed in the official SAP document:https://www.sap.com/documents/2015/07/76525357-5b7c-0010-82c7-eda71af511fa.html

Key Takeaways

  • Traditional Approach: Requires manual extensions at multiple layers; higher maintenance effort.
  • In-App Extensibility: Provides a one-stop, upgrade-safe solution for extending database tables, CDS views, and APIs in a consistent manner.

Acknowledgment

Special thanks to Suresh, Soumya and Aswin for their valuable technical insights and contributions throughout the implementation.

entry.title: SAP Ariba SLP - MDG attachment Integration - Making the Impossible Possible
entry.content:
The integration between SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance (SLP) and SAP Master Data Governance for Suppliers (MDG-S) enables extensive synchronization of supplier master data across both systems through choreographed business scenarios. The SLP-MDG integration supports bidirectional data exchange between SAP Ariba SLP and MDG-S, ensuring consistent supplier master data across both applications. If you would like to know the supported scenarios within this integration, refer to the standard documentation here

In this section, we will cover the details of integrating attachments from Ariba SLP into SAP MDG or SAP ERP systems.  Let's first discuss the potential documents a supplier will upload to Ariba SLP when they register or update their existing registration. 

  • Quality and other Certificates
  • Tax and Financial Documents
  • Supporting Documents that the buyer wants the supplier to upload
  • Contractual or Risk documents

Attachments in Ariba SLP are not restricted to the above documents it could be any Ariba acceptable format that pass the inbuilt Virus test while uploading on the SAP Business Network for Suppliers (which is the UI for the Supplier when trying to register to a Buyer's SLP) 

Secondly, attachment-related inputs can be collected in the Registration, Modular, and Qualification Questionnaire. The SAP Ariba SLP product team recommends receiving certifications with Validity dates through Modular questionnaires only. 

Lastly, Questionnaire respondents can add attachments to a supplier management questionnaire as a response to any of the following questions:

  • Answer type of Attachment.

  • Answer type of Certificate, where one of the certificate detail fields is an attachment field.

  • Any other answer type, with Participant can add additional comments and attachments set to Yes

In the first two cases, the attachment is a direct answer to the question. In the third case, the attachment is an optional addition to the response and can be added with or without a comment. For more details about the attachment sizes supported refer to the help documentation here.

Our Solution: A Dedicated Integration Package for Attachments

Given the context above, customers seeking attachment integration typically fall into two categories:

  1. Existing Users: Customers already live with the standard SAP Ariba SLP integration (via SAP Integration Suite, Managed Gateway for Spend and Business Network/CIG).

  2. New Implementations: Customers planning or currently implementing the standard SAP SLP-MDG/ERP integration through CIG.

Why This Package is Essential

Our integration package is designed to work for both customer groups because it does not disrupt the standard SAP Ariba CIG integration for Supplier Data Integration.

Instead, we leverage SAP Ariba's open APIs and standard SAP MDG APIs, making the package highly consumable, robust, and extensible for future scenarios. We strongly recommend that customers first implement the standard CIG-based integration for core vendor master data integration and then utilize this package to seamlessly supplement it with attachment integration.

Let's now take a look at the architecture at a high level to see how to achieve this.

High-Level Architecture

The integration package, which we have developed and deployed for customers, operates on a continuous polling mechanism:

  1. It checks SAP Ariba SLP at regular intervals for the latest created and changed suppliers.

  2. It identifies suppliers that are Approved and have a Registered status.

  3. Using SAP Ariba Open APIs, it securely transfers the attachments from the questionnaires to the target system (SAP MDG or SAP ERP), which is configurable based on customer requirements.

  4. The package includes the necessary ABAP code to accurately add the attachment to the SAP MDG Change Request or the SAP ERP Business Partner record.

Benefits of deploying this integration package for the Ariba SLP ‚Üí SAP MDG / SAP ERP BP Attachment Integration would be,

  • Fully automated attachment flow, zero manual intervention
  • Reduced onboarding cycle time, Accelerates Supplier Onboarding
  • Lower administrative overhead for Supplier Management teams in Customers
  • More consistent and complete supplier records, strengthening compliance and Auditability
  • Enhances Data Quality and Governance
  • Supports Multiple Integration Scenarios (Both SAP MDG and SAP ERP systems)

Customers have reported a 40-60% reduction in manual effort during supplier onboarding, based on the volume of attachments they handle. 

If you have any further questions, please leave a comment below or send your inquiries to the email CoE_AI_PlanningSpendExec@global.corp.sap. We will be happy to get back to you.

entry.title: SAP EHS Public Cloud: Extending Your Existing Landscape Side-by-Side - Guidebook (Part 3)
entry.content:
Integrating SAP EHS Public Cloud: Extending Your Existing Landscape Side-by-Side - Guidebook

Part 3: Integration of Business Partner & Material from SAP Master Data Governance (MDG)

Table of Contents:

  • 1. Why is this Integration required?
  • 2. Prerequisites
  • 3. Technical Integration
  • 3.1 Communication User & Communication System Setup for SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Configuration
  • 3.1.1 Create Inbound Communication User
  • 3.1.2 Create Communication System
  • 3.2 Business Partner Integration
  • 3.2.1 Communication Arrangement for Integration Scenario SAP_COM_0008
  • 3.2.2 Integrate Business Partner Data from SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
  • 3.3 Product Integration
  • 3.3.1 Communication Arrangement for Integration Scenario SAP_COM_0009
  • 3.3.2 Integrate Products from SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
  • 3.4 Configure Message Monitoring SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
  • 4. Lessons Learned
  • 5. Engage with Us

Related Content:

Below is an overview of the planned blog series ‚Äì each post focusing on a specific integration topic. Once published, the titles will be linked for direct access:

Integrating SAP EHS in the Public Cloud: Extending Your Existing Landscape Side-by-Side ‚Äì Guidebook

Part 1: Introduction & OverviewLink
Part 2: Integration of Employees from SAP SuccessFactorsLink
Part 3: Integration of Business Partners & Material from SAP Master Data Governance (MDG)Link
Part 4: Integration of Functional Locations & Equipment from SAP S/4HANA On-Premise SystemLink
Part 5: Extensibility Scenarios & Further ImplementationLink
Part 6: Summary & OutlookLink

 

1. Why is this Integration required?

Integrating Business Partner and Material master data from SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) into SAP EHS Public Cloud is a foundational step for enabling core EHS processes, particularly in Emissions Management. Instead of maintaining these master data objects locally within SAP EHS Public Cloud, the system relies on harmonized and validated Business Partner and Material data coming from the corporate master data governance layer. This ensures that supplier information, responsible persons, material properties, and classification attributes remain consistent across the enterprise.

Accurate and up-to-date Business Partner and Material data is essential in Environment, Health & Safety (EHS), as many analytical and reporting steps in Emissions Management depend on correctly maintained master data. Examples include assigning responsible Environmental Managers, linking sampling activities to suppliers or contractors, and using material-specific characteristics (e.g., heating values, emission factors, composition) as inputs for emission calculations.

In other words: Without integrated Business Partner and Material data, SAP EHS Public Cloud cannot reliably calculate emissions, assign responsibilities, or produce compliant environmental reports.

Architectural Approach - Scope

The highlighted section of the architectural diagram illustrates the scope relevant to this blog post - focusing on the integration of Business Partner and Material from SAP Master Data Governance (MDG) into SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Reference to User Scenario (C) ‚Äì Emissions Management

In part 1 ‚ÄúIntroduction & Overview‚Äù, the User Scenario (C) ‚Äì Emissions Management at Mike Machineries clearly illustrated why this integration is required:

Scenario Step

Why Business Partner & Material Integration Matters

The Environmental Manager prepares the annual emissions monitoring plan
